Issues.Title: Fixing incorrect name for NumericUpDown editor
Issues.Body:
Fixes #6359


## Proposed changes
- The issue is reproduced when the NumericUpDown.AccessibleObject has no name. In this case, we simply announce the "edit" for text field. This behavior can be considered expected by default. But in accordance with the behavior of the combobox, I suggest announcing the default name for the editor (spinner) if the NumericUpDown.AccessibleObject  did not return a name.
- Added default name for text field inside NumericUpDown.
- Added unit tests

Issues.Title: Fixing issue with announcing of PropertyGrid expanded state
Issues.Body:
Fixes #6656

## Proposed changes
- I think the problem is being reproduced due to competitive requests to Narrator. Periodically it announces expanded state information and periodically skips.
- A possible fix is to replace the standard method `RaiseAutomationPropertyChangedEvent` with the `RaiseAutomationNotification` method. In this case, we force the expanded state information to be announced, which helps avoid a possible contention problem.

## Customer Impact
**Before fix:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/155125271-bb3f3afd-2d5c-4545-b872-eb5e4b8b1422.png)

**After fix:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23376742/155126068-5c41933a-c7b0-4421-8a93-bc120b49a4fb.png)

## Regression? 

- Yes (we have unstable behavior)

## Risk
- Minimal

## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->
- CTI team 
- Manually

## Accessibility testing  <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->
- Narrator
- JAWS
- NVDA

Issues.Title: Native support for UIA patterns
Issues.Body:
a lot of people are trying to automate UI testing. So, we often get requests about automation support from our customers. Currently, in WinForms it is very tricky to support and we haven't found any good documentation about that. 

As a third-party vendor, we'd like WinForms to have some level of native support for UI Automation, similar to WPF implementation: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.automation.peers.frameworkelementautomationpeer?view=windowsdesktop-6.0
I think, it might improve automation support for Microsoft controls as well
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Native support for UIA patterns" (#6733)

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] Narrator cannot announce the expand/collapse state for treeView nodes with checkbox enabled or doing expand/collapse action for any treeNode
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 
7.0.100-preview.2.22116.19

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: 
Yes

**Minimal repro:**
1. Create a Winforms .Net Core application with treeView control added
2. In treeView, add several root treeNodes and child treeNodes

Or use following attached application:
[WinFormsApp4.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8107369/WinFormsApp4.zip)

3. Build and run this application
4. Launch Narrator to test expand/collapse root treeNode

**Actual result:**
Narrator cannot announce the expand/collapse state for treeview nodes with treeView checkBox enabled, or when doing expanding or collapsing action for treenodes. 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/154914880-f3ade506-5f77-4aa2-938d-2ac6417dc224.png)
![TreeView_CheckBox](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26474449/154913766-afd3b6f7-cc49-41f1-9e1e-511b52930d85.gif)

**Expected result:**
Narrator can announce the expand/collapse state when focusing treeview checkbox nodes or doing expanding or collapsing action for them
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] Narrator cannot announce the expand/collapse state for treeView nodes with checkbox enabled or doing expand/collapse action for any treeNode" (#6732)

#### Dirk Gelder on 11/22/2021, 02:37 AM: (private comment, text removed) #### Dirk Gelder on 1/7/2022, 03:52 AM:

Because it has been a while and no solution has been found yet. Attached is even more information neatly according to your own suggested method.

File only one problem or feature request per issue: It’s about de Settings-file automaticly generated like the header says:
'------------------------------------------------------------------------------
’ <auto-generated>
’ This code was generated by a tool.
’ Runtime Version:4.0.30319.42000
’
’ Changes to this file may cause incorrect behavior and will be lost if
’ the code is regenerated.
’ </auto-generated>
'------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The more information you can provide, the easier it will be for us to reproduce and fix your issue.
In the not public post of 21 nov '21 is a compleet project with the same problem, without any other possible problems.
Hence this post filled in with your guidelines to give even more information in a structured way.

Include the following steps with each issue.

  1. Reproducible steps (1… 2… 3…) and what you expected versus what you experienced.
    1.1. I’m starting a new project
    1.2. I opened the project properties
    1.3. Went to the settings tab
    There was no standard fillable table here, but I had to click on a link first to have it create standard files.
    1.4. So let’s create the standard files
    1.5. Settings_1 (as string) and Settings_2 (for integer) created
    1.6. In function ‘Start_up’ the value contained in a textbox and NumericUpDown
    In case of value change, adopt the value in the Settings
    Then you run into the following problems when you debug, this is just the drawing of instructions like on various websites about how it should work.
    This is also what I have done in previous projects.
  2. Images, animations, or a link to a video. Images and animations illustrate repro-steps but don’t replace them.
    See the attachments
  3. As appropriate, a code snippet that demonstrates the issue or a link to a code repository we can easily pull down onto our machine to recreate the issue.
    The code of de project I made to repreduce the problem

Public Class Form1
Private Sub Check_up_settings()
’ Controle of de User settings file in orde is
Try
My.Settings.Reload()
Catch ex As Exception
’ Melding maken
MsgBox(ex.Message)
End Try
End Sub
Private Sub Start_up(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
TextBox1.Text = My.Settings.Setting_1
NumericUpDown1.Value = My.Settings.Setting_2
End Sub

Private Sub Update_setting(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles TextBox1.TextChanged, NumericUpDown1.ValueChanged
    If sender.name = "TextBox1" Then My.Settings.Setting_1 = TextBox1.Text
    If sender.name = "NumericUpDown1" Then My.Settings.Setting_2 = NumericUpDown1.Value
End Sub

End Class

  • Simplify your code around the issue so we can better isolate the problem.**

Even with issues that include rich details, we may be unable to reproduce the issue and may ask for more information!
No problem, only you have to reacte at leatst with a specific request for more information. As far as I know this is all that I can provide.


Issues.Title: [PerMonitorV2] Anchoring controls to Bottom/Right does not work property
Issues.Body:
See attached .NET 6 sample: when moving the form from a screen at 100% to a screen at 125%, the controls anchored right/bottom are not rendered correct.
[DpiSample.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/8096436/DpiSample.zip)


This is at 100%:
![100](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138049/154667297-cd33fac0-7444-429a-b4a6-4a0dd740b595.png)

This is the result when moving the form to the 125% screen:
![125](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/138049/154667367-ccc9d37c-8102-4037-9a10-38ad3dab99ac.png)
The groupbox overlaps the button, and the margins to the right are larger than expected.

In the project file, I set this:
`    <ApplicationHighDpiMode>PerMonitorV2</ApplicationHighDpiMode>`

And the form applies the OS default font (but removing this line does not change the result):
`this.Font = SystemFonts.MessageBoxFont;`

I saw that there are several other issues about "PerMonitorV2", but I can't say whether this problem is reported elsewhere.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[PerMonitorV2] Anchoring controls to Bottom/Right does not work property" (#6717)

Issues.Title: Button_AchorNone_NoResizeOnWindowSizeTallerAsync test is flaky in x86 Release
Issues.Body:
* Global Issue: #6690

* .NET Core Version: 7.0

* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
- Button_AchorNone_NoResizeOnWindowSizeTallerAsync unit test fails sometime in x86 Release CI build for successful PRs, that blocking deployment of fixes into sdk.

**Stack trace** ([System.Windows.Forms.UI.IntegrationTests_net7.0_x86.log](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/public/_build/results?buildId=1611672&view=artifacts&pathAsName=false&type=publishedArtifacts)):
```

      Assert.True() Failure
      Expected: True
      Actual:   False
      Stack Trace:
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/ButtonTests.cs(151,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ButtonTests.<Button_AchorNone_NoResizeOnWindowSizeTallerAsync>b__6_0(Form form, Button button)
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs(244,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.<>c__DisplayClass27_0`1.<<RunFormAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
        --- End of stack trace from previous location ---
           at Microsoft.VisualStudio.Threading.JoinableTask.JoinAsync(CancellationToken cancellationToken)
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs(255,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.RunFormAsync[T](Func`1 createDialog, Func`3 testDriverAsync)
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/Infra/ControlTestBase.cs(173,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ControlTestBase.RunSingleControlTestAsync[T](Func`3 testDriverAsync, Func`1 createControl, Func`1 createForm)
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/ButtonTests.cs(394,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ButtonTests.RunTestAsync(Func`3 runTest)
        /_/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/UIIntegrationTests/ButtonTests.cs(136,0): at System.Windows.Forms.UITests.ButtonTests.Button_AchorNone_NoResizeOnWindowSizeTallerAsync()
        --- End of stack trace from previous location ---
      Output:
        Moving mouse to (276, 318).
        Screen resolution of (1024, 768) translates mouse to (17664, 27136).
```


**Expected behavior:**
- All correct tests pass every time.

**Minimal repro:**
- Run unit tests on x86 environment (or create a PR with changes, CI build will do it)

Issues.Title: Need to skip some flaky test to unblock CI build and deployment
Issues.Body:
This Issue is a storage of all new flaky tests that should be skipped.

* .NET Core Version: 7.0

**Problem description:**
- Some tests fail sometimes and block successful fixes deployment. We have to skip them now, to fix them later, but unblock CI build errors for successful PRs. The global Issue for fixing these tests: #6690.

**Proposed changes:**
- Skip some test cases.
- Put skipped tests to [#6690](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6690) to fix them later.

**Expected behavior:**
- Tests don't fail CI buiild for successful PRs
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Need to skip some flaky test to unblock CI build and deployment" (#6713)

Issues.Title: [release/6.0] Pass SendKeys state by ref
Issues.Body:
Backport of #6710 to release/6.0
Regression introduced in 90f7c1dd955c51c904efd496731a2394cacf578f.
Fixes #6666

**Impact:**
.NET application will not be able to use `SendKeys `method to send grouping of keys/Shortcut keys. They would get following exception if used.

```cs
System.ArgumentException
  HResult=0x80070057
  Message=SendKeys string '^(a)^(c)' is not valid.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms
```

**Fix:**
This was a regression introduced in .NET5.0 while cleaning up the native source to improve perf. Send keys require to send keys info `by reference` and we mistakenly send it `by value`. We are correcting this.

**Testing:**
Unit test added.

**Risk:** 
Low.


/cc @dreddy-work @JeremyKuhne
